source_sentence: 僧伽吒經卷第三
translation: Saṃghâṭṭa-sūtra, Vol. 3

source_sentence: 元魏優禪尼國王子月婆首那譯
translation: Translated by Yue bashunar, Prince of Udyāna, Yuan Dynasty

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the bodhisattva Yakṣa Bodhisattva addressed the Buddha, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故如來出世？」
translation: What causes and conditions did the Tathāgata appear in the world?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakṣa, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 為令眾生多聞具足，是故如來出現於世。
translation: Because the Tathāgata appears in the world to make sentient beings well-versed and complete, the Tathāgata appears in the world.

source_sentence: 如來出世開甘露法，若如來出世則知一切法。
translation: The Tathāgata appears in the world to reveal the nectar Dharma, and if the Tathāgata appears in the world, then he knows all dharmas.

source_sentence: 以方便故，知世間法、出世間法，知世間智、出世間智。」
translation: Because of skillful means, they know worldly and transmundane dharmas and know worldly and transmundane cognition."

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The Boddhisattva par excellence said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世尊知何等法？」
translation: What kind of dharma does the Bhagavān know?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「藥上！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakushō, saying, "Yakushō!

source_sentence: 如來知正法智。
translation: "The Tathāgata knows the cognition of the true teaching.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Medicine!

source_sentence: 以是智故總攝一切法。
translation: Because of this knowledge, all dharmas are included.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Medicine-wise!

source_sentence: 若眾生聞如來出世信法者，此是第一利益。
translation: If sentient beings hear that the Tathāgata has appeared in the world and believe in the Dharma, this is the greatest benefit.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajya!

source_sentence: 譬如有人出行治生，為得利故將千人眾擔負金寶。
translation: It's like a person who travels to govern birth and puts a crowd of a thousand people to work carrying gold and jewelry for profit.

source_sentence: 彼人父母告其人言：『子善諦聽！
translation: That person's parents tell them, 'Son, listen closely!

source_sentence: 此金寶者是他之物，汝好守護莫使亡失。』
translation: This gold treasure belongs to another person, so guard it well and don't let it get lost.'

source_sentence: 其人持寶未經多時自縱放逸，所持金寶悉皆散失。
translation: Before long, that person's possessions become careless and he loses all the gold and jewelry he holds.

source_sentence: 是時彼人憂箭射心，羞愧慚恥不能歸家。
translation: That person's heart was shot with an arrow of grief, and he was too ashamed and embarrassed to return home.

source_sentence: 時彼父母聞已憂愁悲泣而說此言：『我等生此惡子，但有子名生我家內，財物悉皆散失，令我等貧苦，為他奴僕絕望而死。』
translation: When his parents heard this, they were sad and lamented, saying, 'We gave birth to this bad son, but his son's name was born in our home, and all of his possessions were scattered, leaving us poor and destitute, and he died of despair after being made a servant to others.'

source_sentence: 子聞父母既喪亡已亦絕望死。
translation: After hearing that his parents had died, the son also died of despair.

source_sentence: 如是，如是！
translation: Thus, thus!

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Medicine on!

source_sentence: 佛說此法，於我法中無淨信者，彼無所望，臨命終時，為憂惱箭射心而死。
translation: When the Buddha teaches this teaching, those who don't have pure faith in my teaching will have nothing to hope for and will die from the arrow of grief that shoots their hearts when their lives end.

source_sentence: 如彼父母，為彼金寶絕望憂惱。
translation: They're like their parents who are desperate and worried about their gold and jewelry.

source_sentence: 「如是，藥上！
translation: "So it is, Yakushō!

source_sentence: 於我法中無淨心者，臨命終時受諸苦痛。
translation: "When someone lacks a pure mind in regard to my teaching, they'll experience pain and suffering when they reach the end of their life.

source_sentence: 先福受盡彼不種善，臨死時至憂惱箭射，墮於地獄、畜生、餓鬼受諸苦痛，作如是言：『誰救濟我，令我得離地獄、畜生、餓鬼之苦？』
translation: They don't cultivate goodness when their prior merits are exhausted, and when they die, they are shot by an arrow of grief and fall into the pain of hell, the animal kingdom, and the hungry ghosts, saying, 'Who will rescue me and free me from the pain of hell, the animal kingdom, and the hungry ghosts?'

source_sentence: 又如父母告其子言：『未來病苦，病有死苦，汝等得解脫時見行識生，身受苦痛遍體燋惱。
translation: Suppose a parent tells his son, 'In the future, illness is painful, and illness has the pain of death; when you attain liberation, you'll see the birth of the volitional consciousness and experience pain and suffering in your body, and your whole body will be scorched.

source_sentence: 自觀已死眼不見色，耳不聞聲，四支皆痛必歸於死，遍體頑癡猶如木石無所覺知。』
translation: After observing your own death, your eyes won't see form, your ears won't hear sound, the four limbs of your body are painful, and you'll surely return to death, being stubborn and deluded throughout your body like wood and stone with no awareness.'

source_sentence: 子答父母語言：『莫作是語，令我怖畏。
translation: The son replies to his parents, saying, 'Don't say that, for it frightens me.

source_sentence: 觀身無熱，亦無餘病，唯見死怖。
translation: He observes that his body has no fever and no other illnesses, but he's terrified of death.

source_sentence: 我當歸誰？
translation: To whom will I go?'

source_sentence: 誰救濟我？
translation: Who will help me?

source_sentence: 父母若天，誰能救拔？』
translation: 'If parents were gods, who could rescue them?'

source_sentence: 父母答言：『祭祀天神必得安隱。』
translation: The parents replied, 'Sacrifice to the gods and you'll find peace.'

source_sentence: 子答父母：『當速祭祀以求安樂，速至天祠問守廟人。』
translation: The son answered his parents, 'You must quickly make offerings for their well-being; go quickly to the celestial shrine and ask the temple keeper.'

source_sentence: 時彼父母到天祠中，燒香求願。
translation: The parents then went to the shrine and burned incense to ask for their vows.

source_sentence: 守廟者言：『天神瞋怒，須殺羊、殺人以用祭祀，汝子可脫。』
translation: The temple keeper said, 'The gods are angry and must kill sheep and people for sacrifice, so your son can escape.'

source_sentence: 爾時，父母自思惟言：『我等云何？
translation: At that point, the parents thought to themselves, 'What about us?

source_sentence: 我既貧窮，若天神瞋我子必死，若天神喜必得大恩。』
translation: Since I'm poor, if the gods are angry with me, my son will surely die, but if they're pleased, I'll receive a great favor.'

source_sentence: 時速歸家盡賣家財得羊一口。
translation: He then quickly returned home and sold all his family's possessions to get a sheep.

source_sentence: 復語餘人：『且貸我金，十日相還。
translation: He also told the others, 'Perhaps you'll lend me gold and return it to me in ten days.

source_sentence: 若無相還，我身當為君作奴僕。』
translation: If I don't return it, I'll become your servant.'

source_sentence: 其人得金詣市買人，所買之人不知當殺以祭天祠。
translation: That man goes to the market with the gold and buys a man, not knowing that the man he bought will be killed for a sacrifice to the gods.

source_sentence: 病人父母愚癡無智竟不至家，直詣天祠語守廟者：『汝速為我設祭天祠。』
translation: The patient's parents, foolish and ignorant, didn't even go home, so they went straight to the temple guard and said, 'Quickly set up a sacrificial shrine for me.'

source_sentence: 爾時，父母自殺羊、殺人然火祭天。
translation: At that point, the parents themselves killed the sheep and the man, and then they sacrificed them to the gods by fire.

source_sentence: 然後天下告彼父母：『汝等莫怖，我護汝子令得安隱。』
translation: The world then addressed their parents, 'Don't be afraid, for I will protect your son and make him comfortable.'

source_sentence: 爾時，父母踊躍歡喜作如是言：『天神與我大恩，令我子差。』
translation: The parents then leaped for joy and said, 'The gods have shown me great kindness in allowing my son to escape.'

source_sentence: 時彼父母歡喜還家，見兒已死。
translation: Those parents then returned home rejoicing and saw that their son had died.

source_sentence: 爾時，父母見子死已生大愁惱，憂箭射心絕望而死。」
translation: After seeing their son die, the parents became very sad and distressed, and an arrow of grief shot through their hearts and caused them to die of despair."

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 近惡知識亦復如是。」
translation: It's likewise when you're close to a bad friend."

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Yakushō Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是眾生墮於何處？」
translation: Where do such beings fall?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakṣa, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 莫問是事。」
translation: Don't ask about this."

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Boddhisattva Bhaiṣajyaguru said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願佛慈悲說如是人墮在何處？」
translation: May the Buddha have mercy and tell us where such a person has fallen."

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakṣa, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今諦聽！
translation: Now listen closely!

source_sentence: 其人母者墮於大叫地獄之中；其父墮於眾合地獄；其子墮於火燒然地獄；守天廟者墮於阿鼻大地獄中。」
translation: Their mother falls into the hell of great wailing, their father falls into the hell of union, their son falls into the hell of burning, and the guard of the celestial temple falls into the great hell of avīci."

source_sentence: 爾時藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Yakṣa Bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼枉死人生於何處？」
translation: Where did they live in vain?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「彼枉死人生於三十三天之上。」
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō Bodhisattva, "That man of wasteful death lives above the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven."

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Bhaiṣajyaguru Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼枉死人何因緣故，生於三十三天之上？」
translation: What causes and conditions did that wasted-death person have to be born above the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakṣa, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今諦聽！
translation: Now listen closely!

source_sentence: 彼人臨死時，起一念淨心歸依佛陀。
translation: When he's about to die, he gives rise to a single pure thought and relies on the Buddha.

source_sentence: 以此善根，當六十劫受於三十三天之樂，八十劫中自識宿命。
translation: With this good root, he'll be blessed with the bliss of the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven for 60 eons and will know his past life for 80 eons.

source_sentence: 所生之處離諸憂惱，生生之處離諸憂惱，一切苦滅。
translation: Where he's born, he'll be free of sorrow and vexation, and where he's born, he'll be free of sorrow and vexation, and all suffering will cease.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajya-guru!

source_sentence: 近惡知識，不得入於涅槃。」
translation: If you approach a bad friend, you won't be able to enter nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Boddhisattva Bhaiṣajyaguru said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何眾生不能入於涅槃？」
translation: How is it that sentient beings cannot enter nirvāṇa?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「欲求涅槃者當勤精進。」
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō Bodhisattva, "Those who want to pursue nirvāṇa should diligently exert themselves."

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yakushō Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何名精進？」
translation: What is called exertion?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakṣa, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 精進者名須驢多波帝，逆流之果名精進處，娑吉利陀伽彌果名精進處，阿那伽彌果名精進處，阿羅訶果名精進處，波羅提迦佛陀果名精進處，緣覺之智名精進處，菩提薩埵名字、菩提薩埵地果，名精進處。
translation: Those who make effort are called sugata-pati, the stage of effort for the fruit of reversing the flow, the stage of effort for the fruit of sāgiri-dhāraṇī, the stage of effort for the fruit of anāgiri-dhāraṇī, the stage of effort for the fruit of arhat, the stage of effort for the fruit of pratyekabuddha, the stage of effort for the cognition of the solitary realizers, the stage of effort for the names of the bodhisattvas and the stage of effort for the fruit of bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Yakṣu!

source_sentence: 如是等處名精進處。」
translation: Such places are called places of exertion."

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Boddhisattva Bhaiṣajyaguru said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世尊云何逆流？
translation: Bhagavān, how does it go against the flow?

source_sentence: 云何逆流果？」
translation: What is the fruit of reversing the flow?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the bodhisattva Yakṣa, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 譬如有人種於樹木，彼種樹已即日生芽，彼樹一日上下各生長一由旬。
translation: "It's like a person who plants a tree that sprouts the same day after they plant it, and that tree grows up and down for a leap of faith each day.

source_sentence: 復有一人，亦復種樹不得其所，風動不生移置異處。
translation: Another person also plants a tree that doesn't grow, and when the wind blows it doesn't grow, they move it to a different place.

source_sentence: 二人共諍互相誹謗，彼人如是共相諍論。
translation: They both dispute and slander each other, and they thus argue with each other.

source_sentence: 國王聞之即勅臣言：『某處二人互相誹謗，速往喚來。』
translation: When the king heard about this, he ordered his ministers to say, 'There's a place where two people are slandering each other; go quickly and summon them.'

source_sentence: 「傍臣受教遣使往捉。
translation: "The ministers were instructed to send an envoy to arrest them.

source_sentence: 時彼使人微服而去，至彼人所作如是言：『王喚汝等。』
translation: The messenger then departed in light clothing and went to the men and said, 'The king summons you.'

source_sentence: 時彼二人驚怖憂愁：『王今何故命我二人？』
translation: They were then frightened and distressed, 'What did the king order us to do now?'

source_sentence: 是時二人既至王所默然而立。
translation: When they arrived at the king's residence, they stood silently.

source_sentence: 時王問言：『汝等何故共相誹謗而起鬪諍？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why are you both slandering each other and starting a fight?'

source_sentence: 「時彼二人白大王言：『大王！
translation: "Then they both said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 聽我所說。
translation: "Listen to what I've told you.

source_sentence: 我借得少許空閑之處，種植樹林，即日生芽及葉，華果熟者中半。
translation: I borrowed a little bit of open space and planted a grove, and in a few days sprouts and leaves will grow, and the flowers and fruits will ripen in the middle half.

source_sentence: 此人種植不生芽葉及以華果，須臾數移彼種不生，來見謗毀而起鬪諍。
translation: That person planted a grove that didn't produce buds, leaves, and flowers and fruits, and in a moment's time they moved a few times and their seeds didn't grow, so they came to see them and denigrated them, starting a fight.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如是之事，大王應知我無罪過。』
translation: For such a thing, the king should know that I'm not guilty of wrongdoing.'

source_sentence: 「爾時大王，集諸大臣滿三十億，告諸臣言：『汝等各說。』
translation: "It was then that the king gathered his ministers, numbering 3 billion, and told the ministers, 'Tell us each.'

source_sentence: 諸臣白言：『我等不知說何等語？』
translation: The ministers said, 'We don't know what kind of words we're saying.'

source_sentence: 「王問諸臣：『汝等頗見即日種樹即生芽葉及以華果熟者中半。』
translation: "The king asked the ministers, 'Do you see that the tree planted that very day will soon produce buds, leaves, and the middle half of the ripened flowers and fruits?'

source_sentence: 「爾時諸臣從座而起。
translation: "The ministers then got up from their seats.

source_sentence: 白大王言：『大王！
translation: They said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我等不能決定信受如此之言。
translation: We can't decide to believe and accept such words.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 此事希有。』
translation: This is a rare thing.'

source_sentence: 爾時大王問彼人言：『如汝所說，是事實不？』
translation: The king then asked that man, 'Is it true, as you say?'

source_sentence: 爾時彼人白大王言：『此實不謬。』
translation: That man then said to the king, 'It's really not true.'

source_sentence: 王復答言：『如汝所說如此之事，即日種樹即生芽葉及以華果，此事難信。』
translation: The king then answered, 'Such a thing as you say would cause a tree planted that very day to produce buds, leaves, and flowers and fruits, which is hard to believe.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼人白大王言：『願王自植知其虛實。』
translation: Those people then said to the king, 'May the king plant himself and know what's real and unreal.'

source_sentence: 「時王集三十億臣禁守彼人，然後大王自種其樹，不生芽葉，不生華果。
translation: "The king then gathered 3 billion ministers to restrain that man, and the king planted his own tree, which didn't produce buds, leaves, or flowers and fruit.

source_sentence: 爾時大王，心大恚怒勅諸臣言：『汝等速取利斧，彼所種樹仰令斫伐。』
translation: The king then became furious and commanded his ministers, 'Quickly take a sharp ax and chop down the tree that was planted there.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸臣受王教令斫斷彼樹，一樹斷已生十二樹，斫十二樹斷生二十四樹，莖、葉、華、果皆是七寶。
translation: The ministers then were instructed by the king to chop down that tree, and after cutting down one tree, twelve trees were produced, and chopping down twelve trees produced twenty-four trees with stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits that were all seven treasures.

source_sentence: 爾時二十四樹，變生二十四億雞鳥，皆是金嘴七寶羽翼。
translation: From those twenty-four trees then came twenty-four billion fowls and birds, all with golden beaks and seven-jewel wings.

source_sentence: 爾時，大王復生瞋怒，自執利斧往伐彼樹。
translation: The king then became angry again and took his own sharp ax to chop down that tree.

source_sentence: 王斫樹時，從樹出生甘泉美水。
translation: When the king chopped down the tree, a sweet spring of beautiful water sprang from it.

source_sentence: 時王慚愧勅諸臣言：『放彼二人。』
translation: Ashamed, the king then commanded his ministers, saying, 'Let those two go!'

source_sentence: 諸臣白言：『大王！
translation: The ministers said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 受教。』
translation: I'll accept your teaching.'

source_sentence: 諸臣去已，放彼二人將至王所。
translation: After the ministers left, they released those two men, who were about to go to the king.

source_sentence: 王問其人：『汝種此樹。
translation: The king asked them, 'Did you plant this tree?

source_sentence: 斫汝一樹生十二樹，斫十二樹生二十四樹。
translation: Chop down one of your trees and you'll grow 12 trees, and chop down 12 trees and you'll grow 24 trees.

source_sentence: 我所種樹不生芽葉，不生華果。
translation: The tree I planted doesn't produce buds and leaves, and it doesn't produce flowers and fruit.

source_sentence: 此事云何？』
translation: What's the matter with that?'

source_sentence: 其人答王：『如我此福德，大王則無如是福德。』
translation: That man answered the king, 'Such is my merit, but the great king has no such merit.'

source_sentence: 爾時三十億大臣胡跪，白其人言：『汝可治國而居王位。』
translation: Three billion ministers then knelt down and said to that man, 'You could rule the country and sit on the king's throne.'

source_sentence: 爾時其人，為諸臣眾，而說偈言：「『我不求王位，　　不求世財寶；　　心懷無上願，　　願成二足尊。
translation: That man then spoke a verse for his ministers, saying, 'I don't seek the position of king or worldly possessions; with the unsurpassed vow in mind, I want to become a two-legged honored one.

source_sentence: 得寂滅涅槃，　　至彼成如來；　　為汝等說法，　　令到涅槃城。
translation: I will attain nirvāṇa of cessation and become a tathāgata there; I will teach you all and cause you to reach the city of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 如來亦復如是，燒諸煩惱、滅諸病苦，猶如彼人為令闇室眾生安隱，自燒而死。
translation: "The Tathāgata likewise burns afflictions and extinguishes illness and suffering, just as a person burns themselves to death to make a dark room comfortable for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如來如是，為諸眾生令得安隱，不惜身命拔諸繫縛令得解脫。
translation: Thus, the Tathāgata makes sentient beings comfortable, sparing no life to remove the bonds that bind them and make them liberated.

source_sentence: 如是，藥上！
translation: Thus, Yakushō!

source_sentence: 如來永離三毒之惱，為諸世間作大燈明，於地獄、畜生、餓鬼、阿修羅，老少眾生拔令解脫。」
translation: The Tathāgata is forever free of the three poisons and creates a great lamp for the world, liberating hell, animals, hungry ghosts, asuras, and sentient beings young and old."

source_sentence: 爾時諸天，於虛空中，而說偈言：「最勝好福田，　　一切田中勝，　世間無上尊。
translation: It was then that the gods spoke a verse in the sky, saying, "The most excellent field of good fortune, the best of all fields, is the highest in the world.

source_sentence: 增長諸佛子，　佛田最勝田，　　能除諸怖畏。
translation: It's the most excellent field of buddha-fields that can remove fears and intimidations.

source_sentence: 大師善方便，　　守護諸眾生，　住於涅槃界，　　而示在世間，　令世間寂滅。
translation: The great teacher is a skillful means of guarding sentient beings, abiding in the realm of nirvāṇa and showing them to the world, causing the world to become tranquil.

source_sentence: 佛為無上師，　救護少眾生，　　亦救老眾生，　三界諸眾生，　　方便而度之。
translation: The Buddha is the unsurpassed teacher, saving little sentient beings, saving old sentient beings, and saving all sentient beings in the three realms with skillful means.

source_sentence: 閉諸地獄門，　　及畜生、餓鬼；　此世得安樂，　　他世亦安樂。」
translation: He closes the gates of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts; he attains well-being in this world and well-being in other worlds as well."

source_sentence: 爾時如來，即時微笑而說偈言：「善哉！
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata immediately smiled and spoke a verse, saying, "Good!

source_sentence: 見善人，　　善哉！
translation: Good man, good man!

source_sentence: 見佛陀，　善哉！
translation: Good, seeing the Buddha!

source_sentence: 聞法者，　　善哉！
translation: Hearers of the Dharma, excellent!

source_sentence: 能敬僧，　善哉！
translation: How nice of you to honor the saṃgha!

source_sentence: 此法門，　　滅除一切惡。」
translation: This is the Dharma teaching that ceases all evil."

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Yakushō Bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故如來微笑？
translation: What is the reason why the Tathāgata smiles?

source_sentence: 若無因緣，如來終不現希有相。」
translation: Without causes and conditions, the Tathāgata would never have shown rare appearances."

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝見此等少眾生不？」
translation: Do you see these few sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 藥上白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Hermit said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯然已見。」
translation: Only yes, I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 此諸眾生今日皆得住於十地。」
translation: Today, all these sentient beings will attain abiding in the tenth ground."

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵，踊身虛空高八萬由旬，共八萬億天子，於如來上散眾妙花，地上年少諸眾生等皆禮佛足。
translation: At the time, Yakushō Bodhisattva Mahāsattva swarmed his body 80,000 yojanas high in the sky, and a total of 80,000,000 sons of gods scattered multitudes of marvelous flowers above the Tathāgata, while young sentient beings on the ground bowed their heads to the Buddha's feet.

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上於虛空中而作是言：「三千大千世界眾生皆聞此聲，地獄眾生聞此聲者悉得解脫，三十三天聞此音聲皆來集會。」
translation: At the time, Yama spoke up in the sky, saying, "All the sentient beings in the 3,000,000 worlds hear this sound, all the sentient beings in hell who hear it are liberated, and all the Trāyastriṃśa gods who hear it come together."

source_sentence: 時三千大千世界六種震動，時大海中八萬四千龍王動而來集，三萬億閻浮提夜叉俱來集會，二萬五千億羅剎餓鬼俱來集會，時如來所大眾悉集。
translation: When six of the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds shook, 84,000 dragon kings in the ocean moved and gathered, 3,000,000,000 Jambudvīpa nightjars all came to assemble, and 2,500,000,000 Rāṣṭrapāla hungry ghosts all came to assemble, and the great multitude of the Tathāgata's abodes assembled.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來為諸年少眾生說法。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata was teaching the Dharma to young sentient beings.

source_sentence: 從十方世界有百千億諸菩薩眾，各以自神力俱來集會。
translation: From the worlds in the ten directions, a hundred thousand billion bodhisattvas each came to assemble with their own spiritual powers.

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva Yakushō said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 從十方國有無量菩薩俱來集會，無量天、龍、夜叉、揵闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、餓鬼、地獄，皆來集會欲聞正法，唯願世尊當為說之。」
translation: From countries in the ten directions, measureless bodhisattvas have come together, and measureless gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, hungry ghosts, and hells have gathered here wanting to hear the right teaching, so may the Bhagavān please teach it for them."

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝下至此。」
translation: Go down to this place."

source_sentence: 爾時藥上菩提薩埵，以自神力從上而下，向佛合掌頂禮佛足，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Yakushō Bodhisattva descended from above with his own supernormal powers, saluted the Buddha with his palms together at his feet, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 法聚。
translation: "It's a cluster of dharmas.

source_sentence: 法聚者何因緣故，名為法聚？」
translation: What are the causes and conditions for this to be called a cluster of dharmas?"

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 法聚者名曰淨行，淨行者能離一切不善之法。
translation: "The group of dharmas is called pure practice, and pure practice is able to part with all unskillful things.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝見如此少眾生不？」
translation: Do you see so few sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 藥上白佛：「唯然已見。」
translation: Yakushō said to the Buddha, "Only yes, I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「此諸眾生離邪婬故，必得諸陀羅尼，必得具足一切諸法。」
translation: The Buddha told Yakushō, "Because these sentient beings are free of wrong sexual behavior, they will surely attain the dhāraṇīs and will surely attain the full possession of all the teachings."

source_sentence: 僧伽吒經卷第三
translation: Saṃghâṭṭa-sūtra, Volume 3
